verses.verse: If I have repaid evil to him who was at peace with me, Or (1 Sam. 24:7; 26:9) have plundered my enemy without cause,
Let the enemy pursue me and overtake me; Yes, let him trample my life to the earth, And lay my honor in the dust. Selah
Arise, O LORD, in Your anger; (Ps. 94:2) Lift Yourself up because of the rage of my enemies; (Ps. 35:23; 44:23) Rise up for me to the judgment You have commanded!
So the congregation of the peoples shall surround You; For their sakes, therefore, return on high.
The LORD shall judge the peoples; (Ps. 26:1; 35:24; 43:1) Judge me, O LORD, (Ps. 18:20; 35:24) according to my righteousness, And according to my integrity within me.
Oh, let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end, But establish the just; ((1 Sam. 16:7)) For the righteous God tests the hearts and minds.
My defense is of God, Who saves the (Ps. 97:10, 11; 125:4) upright in heart.
God is a just judge, And God is angry with the wicked every day.
If he does not turn back, He will (Deut. 32:41) sharpen His sword; He bends His bow and makes it ready.
